question: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac helped to promote homeownership by purchasing mortgages from banks and guaranteeing loans.
The primary reason for the U.S. housing bubble was a lack of government intervention in the housing market.
The rise of speculative behavior in housing was one of the key drivers behind the bursting of the housing bubble.
Subprime mortgages were given exclusively to borrowers with excellent credit histories.
Tax incentives for homeowners had a significant role in inflating the housing market in the U.S.
The housing bubble burst due to the lack of investment in mortgage-backed securities.
The 2008 financial crisis was caused solely by the collapse of the stock market.
Mortgage-backed securities and collateralized debt obligations (CDOs) contributed to the housing bubble by offering investors ways to profit from rising home prices.
The U.S. government responded to the housing crisis by implementing massive bailouts and housing stimulus programs.
The collapse of the U.S. housing market led to a global economic recovery.
